title: CollaborativeAR
blurb: For the first time ever, share a space in AR with other friends, on your iPhone
content_html:
Brief Description of Project

Currently, Mobile augmented reality (AR) technology doesn’t provide a solution for creating shared AR experiences. With our platform, mobile AR developers and designers can create a new class of AR experience where multiple collaborators can engage in a shared space. This has rich applications in education, collaborative working, prototyping, to name a few. For the first time ever, we have made a strategy that allows for the aligning of worlds in AR experiences, opening the possibilities for AR experiences of all types.

Team Members:

Abby Ayers, Joseph Crotchett, Kenny Friedman, Avery Lamp, Xiao Ling

  • platform: ARKit
  • Development Tools: Maya, XCode, Substance Painter, Git
  • SDKs: iOS
  • APIs: ARKit
  • Assets: None
  • Libraries: None
  • Components not created in this Hackathon; - Code: None - Assets: - Planet Textures - http://planetpixelemporium.com/planets.html - Chess Board - https://github.com/d-ronnqvist/SCNBook-code/tree/obj-c MIT license

License

All sample code has an MIT License, but some assets may have a different license. Such exceptions are mentioned in the license that is included with that specific sample project.

## Brief Description of Project


Currently, Mobile augmented reality (AR) technology doesn’t provide a solution for creating shared AR experiences. With our platform, mobile AR developers and designers can create a new class of AR experience where multiple collaborators can engage in a shared space. This has rich applications in education, collaborative working, prototyping, to name a few. For the first time ever, we have made a strategy that allows for the aligning of worlds in AR experiences, opening the possibilities for AR experiences of all types.


## Team Members:


Abby Ayers, Joseph Crotchett, Kenny Friedman, Avery Lamp, Xiao Ling


* platform: ARKit
* Development Tools: Maya, XCode, Substance Painter, Git
